description:
Ripped 6 discs to FLAC without issue. Every single disc since- Unknown artist-Unknown Album/Unknown song.

I find it very hard to believe that The Joshua Tree is not in the freakin' DB. Same for Black Sunday, and Crazy World.

I understand that a "pointer" or something may be wrong, but gnudb.gnudb.org 8880, right (I didn't change it)?
As the title sais.

Just ripped a cd to flac with no probs. Labelled all the
tracks correctly. Reminds me of Xrecode, a Windows
program. I'm using Lubuntu Jammy J.
easy to use. had to install a package called lame to encode mp3 format. the command for that is "sudo apt install lame".
summary: worked good for ripping old audio disc on 19.04

description: easy to use, good CDDB usage
It works on Ubuntu 20.04 fine. It's a pity the snap version is broken.

Easier and faster than ripperx. 
Only rips up to 245 bps not 320 bps. Not that I can tell the difference .
I recommend It

Super simple, very fast and easy to use with Ubuntu 20.04. None of the gaps and pauses I kept getting with Sound Juicer, and several times faster.
Creates perfect FLAC files from my CDs, with all the names and track info installed automatically. A++
summary: Works perfectly with the new CDDB update

description: Just what i needed. Supports multiple file formats. Very easy to use. Highly recommended!

Asunder is a very good CD ripper. But to rip to MP3s, it needs LAME to be installed at the same time. I had to uninststall the version from the Ubuntu Software store and I used apt-get to install it with lame and asunder-docs. 
After also changing the CDDB settings to point to gnudb.gnudb.org, everything worked great. Hopefully the Ubuntu Software store will add checkboxes to add the optional packages with Asunder during installation for a complete experience. I gave Asunder five stars, but the Ubuntu Software store gets a 2 for this oversight.
summary: This version lacks ability to install LAME required for MP3's

description: Using this with Ubuntu to rip audio from CD-R's. Those old recordable CD's apparently don't last forever as I'm having problems with ones from the late 1990's and early 2000's. Errors more prevalent toward the end of the disc capacity.  Asunder is usually very fast, but if it sticks, I'll walk away and come back later. Many times, Asunder is able to figure out the disc error and recover the audio track.   Many thanks to the folks who wrote it and provided it for free.

The Good: It can simmultaneously encode like a half dozen different files out of each CD track. (Not sure who needs that, but whatever)

The Bad: if your CD isn't in Gracenote (the CD database), you'll be faced with a fairly clunky manual input interface. Also, I haven't found how to sent my titles to Gracenote.
user_display: Ignacio A Ramírez Martín del Campo

description: Excellent app. Too bad it doesn't support MusicBrainz. It still tries to use CDDB which is no longer active. Add support, and it will be 5-stars.

This works well for ripping CDs. The interface is simple, and the error correction can be useful. The version for 20.04 points to a dead CDDB server. You can change it to gnudb.gnudb.org, port 8880 in the preferences to get working album information lookup again. I couldn't get the Musicbrainz freedb gateway to work.

Thanks to trunk's tip the database works very well now. The lack of it was a bother. It's good that you can set your preferences. I don't recall that you could with Sound Juicer, which I used once upon a time.
Simple and easy UI. Configurable. @trunk has the solution for the cddb issue.

Great, simple software. Just keep in mind that the CDDB Database has moved. Under Advanced, the new server address should be gnudb.gnudb.org at port 8880.

I rarely give anything 5 star ratings. Asunder gets that from me because it's simply THAT good!
uninstall don,t work in debian buster
It's a great software for me!
Can't rip CD in .mp3
It works very reliably for me on Xubuntu 20.04

simple cd ripper i think the cd track info site might not work and you have to untick some of the encoders because it does in standard setting several codec extentions at once the wav file result is clear but fre;ac ripper sounds better for classical stuff to me
I use it for ripping my CD collection into flac. Easy to use. It works perfectly.
Extremely easy to use and configure. Always check the options before starting.

It works. Simple interface. Perfection.

Better than ripperx

had to install lame (sudo apt-get install asunder lame) and change cddb to (gnudb.gnudb.org)
It doesn't launch at all; throws an error in terminal.
The app doesn't even launch. I wanted to try this program. It's a waste of time
summary: Doesn't work in Fedora 31 (perhaps because of Wayland)

description: cant use it dont have a cd drive

Love this program, but Freedb is no longer active (since March 2000) Not sure what to do now (apart from typing in the info myself). I have had a quick look at MusicBrainz, but not sure if I can link it to Asunder.......
Just have to keep typing I suppose!

You can select whatever format you want and batch-convert files from .wav to...lets say, vorbis,mp3,wmv,m4a++++

No Dolby Atmos support as of yet I believe..
Pretty good. I with it had a button to select or deselct everything at once, but it works well and even allows converting to other formats.
rippt schnell und sauber, man muss allerdings lame noch installieren um zu mp3 umzuwandeln
Funktioniert gut, schnell und einfach, ich empfehle, die Anwendung einfach immer im Hintergrund geöffnet zu lassen.
Kann keine mp3 erzeugen. Die erforderliche Ergänzung lame im Store nicht mehr verfügbar. Wer verwendet Musik nicht im mp3 Format?

Von wegen:
Kann keine mp3 erzeugen. Die erforderliche Ergänzung lame im Store nicht mehr verfügbar. Wer verwendet Musik nicht im mp3 Format?
Einfach vorher oder nach der Installation "sudo apt install lame" und dann funktioniert auch Asunder mit mp3 Encoding.
Würde mir noch wünschen, mehrere Tracks als einen Track rippen zu können. Ansonsten super Programm

Nehme diese Anwendung seit Jahren. Funktioniert seit Jahren auch ohne Probleme.

Und wegen mp3, etntweder lame über Terminal installieren wie es hier schon geäußert wurde. Oder installiert Synaptic und installiert es über dieses Softwareverwaltung dann.
Leider ruft dieser Ripper keine CDDB Daten mehr aus dem Internet ab. Leider muss alles per Hand eingegeben werden. Bitte den Bug fixen.
summary: Ruft keine CDDB Daten aus dem Internet ab

description:
Einfach schön und schön einfach. 
Um CDDB Daten auszulesen unter Erweitert: 
freedb.freedb.org gegen gnudb.gnudb.org 
ersetzten.

Ich benutze Asunder schon seit jahren, um CDs in MP3 umzuwandeln.
Die aktuelle Version ist leider für diesen Zweck nicht mehr zu gebrauchen.
Also weg damit.
summary: Leider funktioniert die Erstellung von MP3s trotz Lame nicht

description:
Nicht so perfekt wie CDEx aber nahe dran. Gefühlt aber langsamer. Formate gut einstellbar (ich empfehle OGG) 
CDDB könnte etwas mehr Treffer und intuitive Integration vertragen, damit man leicht CD Daten hinzufügen kann.
funktioniert alles so wie es soll, einfach perfekt
Sin embargo, tuve que cambiar el cddb a gnudb.gnudb.org de lo contrario no bajaba los datos de los discos.
Gracias a la reseña de Ben, he instalado el programa. Muy bueno y sin florituras, promete lo que dice. Gracias al desarrollador.
Hace lo que tiene que hacer, ripear cds a la tasa de bits que deseas en mp3. Admite otros codecs.
Simple d'utilisation et efficace. il reconnaît facilement les tags. Parfait.
Parfaite interface graphique ainsi que fonctionnalités qui sont simples et efficaces. Un bon logiciel pour quiconque veux ripper occasionnellement ses disques!
Un bon extracteur de cd musical, un seul bémol un peu lent.
Vraiment excellent, vraiment simple, vraiment rapide, vraiment tout.
summary: Vraiment excellent, vraiment simple, vraiment rapide, vraiment tout

description: sinon le logiciel fonctionnait très bien jusqu'à tout récemment
summary: ne fait plus les recherches de titres depuis quelque temps

description:
Le logiciel est très bien fait. En premier niveau extrêmement simple et ergonomique, il a, mine de rien tout le niveau de personnalisation qu'un amateur peut désirer. 
Fonctionne très bien sous UBUNTU 18.10. 
Attention, l'adresse du serveur CDDB n'était plus correcte. Il a fallu retrouver.
summary: Nickel, le juste nécessaire pour ripper exactement comme on veut

description:
gnudb.gnudb.org

maintient la base libre CDDB lancée en 2000 et abandonnée par Magix en 2020
https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedb
summary: nouvelle adresse chez gnudb pour base libre CDDB :

description: Va à l'essentiel

Il fait pour ce qu'il a été créée.
Debian Sid
Le meilleur encodeur de CD, lit tout les CD récupère facilement les informations du CD et encode dans de multiple formats

Je l'utilise pour convertir mes CD en flac (il peut utiliser d'autres formats, comme ape, mp3, ogg, wv). On peut extraire une ou plusieurs plages, reconnaître automatiquement les titres (via une base sur Internet). Très simple et performant.
Instable, S'arrête seul, ne lit pas le nom des pistes du CD ni le titre. Inutilisable
Быстро справилось с задачей копирования диска в Flac. Качество перекодированных файлов на хорошем уровне, без искажений.
Impossible to edit headers with two or more languages
summary: Impossible to edit headers with two or more languages
